description.narrative: The overall objective of the programme is to contribute to the development of a democratic Iraq. The programme is focused on the promotion of human rights and strengthening of rule of law, which according to the Iraqi Development plan 2011-13 are crucial elements in order to change a development of terror and political instability. The programme consists of two components: Support to Human Rights and rule of law targeting the establishment of an independent Human Rights Commission and a family protection programme; and a component, ¿Voice and Accountability¿ targeting the establishment of an Academy of Anti-Corruption, support for civil society and a media support programme. Except the media support programme, which is implemented by international Media Support, UNDP/UNICEF are the implementing actors within the framework of UN Development Assistance Fund. The individual programme activities are co-funded with other aid donors and addresses areas of problem, which attracts extensive political attention, so that the programme contributes to change in the short term, while also supporting the long term democratic development.
